ATLANTIC BASEBALL LEAGUE
INJURIES

BNN Index | ABL | SCORES | STANDINGS | STATS | TEAMS | PLAYERS | TRANSACTIONS | HISTORY
 
Wednesday, December 21st, 1932
Halifax Highlanders: Albert Chauvet has suffered a setback in his recovery. He is not expected to recover for another 5 days.

Champlain Coureurs: LF Chad Pelletier was injured being hit by a pitch. The Diagnosis: Bone bruise (wrist). He's expected to miss about 3-4 weeks.
Sunday, June 2nd, 1929
Pointe-Sainte-Anne Acadiens: RF Rafe Myers was injured while throwing the ball. The Diagnosis: Neck stiffness. This is a day-to-day injury expected to last 6 days.
Saturday, June 1st, 1929
Quebec City Jr. Nordiques: SP Steve Lowenstein was injured while pitching. The Diagnosis: Forearm soreness. This is a day-to-day injury expected to last 4 days.
New Britain Yankees: SP Raphael Simard was injured while pitching. The Diagnosis: Neck stiffness. This is a day-to-day injury expected to last 4 days.
Drummondville Voltigeurs: SP Mario Gonzalez was injured while pitching. The Diagnosis: Sprained elbow. This is a day-to-day injury expected to last one week.
Halifax Highlanders: CL Crusher Edwards was injured while pitching. The diagnosis is not yet known.
Thursday, May 30th, 1929
Hartford Whalers: C Atit Cardew was injured . The Diagnosis: Food poisoning. This injury keeps him out of action for 2 days.
St. John's Mariners: LF Andrew Clowers was injured . The Diagnosis: Viral infection. This is a day-to-day injury expected to last 4 days.
Wednesday, May 29th, 1929
Montreal Jr. Royales: 1B Cly States diagnosed with a sore elbow, is day-to-day for 2 days.
Pawtucket Red Sox: Sam Bible has suffered a setback in his recovery. He is not expected to recover for another one week.

Sherbrooke Canadiens: CF Edward Hidalgo was injured . The Diagnosis: Flu. This is a day-to-day injury expected to last 3 days.
Quincy Gunners: RP Peerapol Thongsukh diagnosed with forearm inflammation, will miss 3 months.

Pointe-Sainte-Anne Acadiens: 3B Irfan Begley was injured being hit by a pitch. The diagnosis is not yet known.

Pawtucket Red Sox: Annan Lamontagne has suffered a setback in his recovery. He is not expected to recover for another 1-2 weeks.

Quebec City Jr. Nordiques: 1B Vinny Byrd was injured when he was robbed and mugged after his house was broken into during the middle of the night. The Diagnosis: Fractured wrist. This injury keeps him out of action for 4-5 weeks.

Halifax Highlanders: LF Chad Rémillard was injured in a collision at a base. The diagnosis is not yet known.
Halifax Highlanders: 1B Corentin Guillemot was injured while running the bases. The Diagnosis: Back stiffness. This is a day-to-day injury expected to last 2 weeks.
Pointe-Sainte-Anne Acadiens: CF Ervin Hicks was injured while running the bases. The Diagnosis: Groin tightness. This is a day-to-day injury expected to last 3 days.
Providence Bruins: SS Marc Le Roy was injured being hit by a pitch. The Diagnosis: Thumb contusion. This is a day-to-day injury expected to last 2 days.
Monday, May 9th, 1921
Halifax Highlanders: SP Auguste Lefèvre was injured . The Diagnosis: Flu-like symptoms. This is a day-to-day injury expected to last 1 day.
Sunday, May 8th, 1921
Hartford Whalers: 1B Jack Frawley diagnosed with back spasms, but will not miss any additional time.
Halifax Highlanders: LF Chad Rémillard was injured while running the bases. The Diagnosis: Sore back. This is a day-to-day injury expected to last 4 days.
Quebec City Jr. Nordiques: RF Jethro Kathol was injured while throwing the ball. The diagnosis is not yet known.
Pointe-Sainte-Anne Acadiens: CF Ervin Hicks was injured while throwing the ball. The Diagnosis: Sprained ankle. This is a day-to-day injury expected to last 4 days.
Saturday, May 7th, 1921
Montreal Jr. Royales: 2B Crispin McFadden diagnosed with a fractured thumb, will miss 3 weeks.
Hartford Whalers: 1B Jack Frawley was injured while pitching. The diagnosis is not yet known.
Friday, May 6th, 1921
Montreal Jr. Royales: LF Brandon Kniep diagnosed with a strained oblique, will miss 5 weeks.
Sherbrooke Canadiens: SS Brendan Grenier was injured while running the bases. The Diagnosis: Back spasms. This is a day-to-day injury expected to last 1 day.
Thursday, May 5th, 1921
St. John's Mariners: LF Yannawit Gemmill was injured while throwing the ball. The Diagnosis: Sprained elbow. He's expected to miss about 5-6 weeks.
Montreal Jr. Royales: 2B Crispin McFadden was injured being hit by a pitch. The diagnosis is not yet known.
Quincy Gunners: SS Supachat Drum was injured while throwing the ball. The Diagnosis: Dead arm. He's expected to miss about 6 days.
Sherbrooke Canadiens: RF Jordan Cloutier was injured while throwing the ball. The Diagnosis: Mild calf strain. This is a day-to-day injury expected to last 2 days.
Wednesday, May 4th, 1921
New Britain Yankees: 2B Zeke Martello diagnosed with a fractured finger, will miss 8 weeks.
Hartford Whalers: 1B Carleton McCracken was injured being hit by a pitch. The Diagnosis: Bruised knee. This is a day-to-day injury expected to last 2 days.
Quebec City Jr. Nordiques: C Jimmy Blanc was injured while running the bases. The Diagnosis: Concussion. This is a day-to-day injury expected to last 4 days.
Tuesday, May 3rd, 1921
St. John's Mariners: RF Autthagowit Agnes was injured while throwing the ball. The Diagnosis: Tired arm. This is a day-to-day injury expected to last 5 days.
Champlain Coureurs: CF Jack Cooper was injured while throwing the ball. The Diagnosis: Sore thumb. This is a day-to-day injury expected to last 1 day.
Montreal Jr. Royales: LF Brandon Kniep was injured while throwing the ball. The diagnosis is not yet known.
Monday, May 2nd, 1921
Quebec City Jr. Nordiques: CF Christian Culver diagnosed with a finger blister, is day-to-day for 2 days.
Coude Voyageurs: CF Emerson Valeri diagnosed with a mild calf strain, is day-to-day for 2 days.
New Britain Yankees: 2B Zeke Martello was injured in a collision at a base. The diagnosis is not yet known.
Halifax Highlanders: SP De'Ron Dent was injured while pitching. The Diagnosis: Sore back. This is a day-to-day injury expected to last 1 day.
Sunday, May 1st, 1921
Halifax Highlanders: 1B Kantaphat Brazier diagnosed with a fractured foot, will miss 2 weeks.
Hartford Whalers: 2B Eric Kinnear diagnosed with calf cramps, but will not miss any additional time.
New Britain Yankees: SS Jake Culbreth was injured while running the bases. The Diagnosis: Strained rib cage muscle. This is a day-to-day injury expected to last one week.
Saturday, April 30th, 1921
Quebec City Jr. Nordiques: CF Christian Culver was injured while throwing the ball. The diagnosis is not yet known.
Coude Voyageurs: CF Emerson Valeri was injured while throwing the ball. The diagnosis is not yet known.

Hartford Whalers: 2B Eric Kinnear was injured while running the bases. The diagnosis is not yet known.
Friday, April 29th, 1921
Drummondville Voltigeurs: 3B Jodie Day was injured in a collision at a base. The Diagnosis: Mild shoulder strain. This is a day-to-day injury expected to last 5 days.
Providence Bruins: SP Bastien Rioux was injured being hit by a pitch. The Diagnosis: Bruised knee. This is a day-to-day injury expected to last 1 day.
Thursday, April 28th, 1921
Quebec City Jr. Nordiques: 1B Michael Hughes was injured . The Diagnosis: Stomach virus. This is a day-to-day injury expected to last 3 days.
